embeds.description:
# Choose Your Alignment

Alignment describes a character's moral and ethical outlook, balancing their sense of Good vs. Evil and Law vs. Chaos. It helps define whether a character is compassionate and follows rules (Good and Lawful), self-serving and disruptive (Evil and Chaotic), or somewhere in between. This framework shapes how they make decisions, interact with others, and approach challenges in the game world.

options.label: Lawful Good
options.description: Follows the rules and seeks to do what's right, helping others and upholding justice.

options.label: Neutral Good
options.description: Does what's right according to their conscience, without being bound by laws or chaos.

options.label: Chaotic Good
options.description: Fights for good but rejects authority and rules in favor of freedom.

options.label: Lawful Neutral
options.description: Strictly follows laws and order, believing structure is key to a stable society.

options.label: Neutral
options.description: Strives for balance, not swayed by good, evil, law, or chaos.

options.label: Chaotic Neutral
options.description: Values freedom and individuality, avoiding restrictions or commitments to any cause.

options.label: Lawful Evil
options.description: Uses laws and structure to manipulate and control for personal gain.

options.label: Neutral Evil
options.description: Self-serving and opportunistic, doing whatever benefits them, regardless of laws or morals.

options.label: Chaotic Evil
options.description: Seeks destruction and personal gain with little regard for rules, order, or others.
